private_information: I can move disks A B C D E F G where A is smallest and G is larger than A..F
I can only perform moves that pick up and place a single disk at a time
I must respect the Tower of Hanoi rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the final peg configuration described by the global goal by generating an ordered list of primitive moves for disks A B C D E F G that respects my permissions and the Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move disks H I J K L M N where H is smallest of my group and N is largest
I can only perform atomic single-disk moves and must obey size constraints
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the final peg configuration described by the global goal by generating an ordered list of primitive moves for disks H I J K L M N that respects my permissions and the Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move disks O P Q R S T where O is smallest of my group and T is largest overall
I can only perform atomic single-disk moves and must obey size constraints
agent_3.goal: Contribute to achieving the final peg configuration described by the global goal by generating an ordered list of primitive moves for disks O P Q R S T that respects my permissions and the Tower of Hanoi rules.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move lists and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem tailored for the FastDownwards solver that models the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and achieves the target configuration.

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi with three pegs: left, middle, right
Only one disk may be moved at a time
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Disks are totally ordered by size from A (smallest) to T (largest)
Agents have exclusive rights to move only specified subsets of disks
Initial stack: left peg from top to bottom A through T; middle and right pegs empty
Target configuration as specified in environment.init.goal_configuration

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi scenario. You have permission to move disks A B C D E F G. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only these disks and that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current public information. Format each move exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from PEG1 to PEG2'. Do not output PDDL. Ensure the move sequence is self-consistent with the initial and goal configurations as far as your disk set is concerned.
generate_moves.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Output a single ordered list of primitive moves in the required format. If you need to reference other agents' actions, note dependencies but do not assume their moves; produce only moves you are authorized to perform.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi scenario. You have permission to move disks H I J K L M N. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only these disks and that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current public information. Format each move exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from PEG1 to PEG2'. Do not output PDDL. Ensure the move sequence is self-consistent with the initial and goal configurations as far as your disk set is concerned.
generate_moves.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Output a single ordered list of primitive moves in the required format. If you need to reference other agents' actions, note dependencies but do not assume their moves; produce only moves you are authorized to perform.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi scenario. You have permission to move disks O P Q R S T. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only these disks and that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the current public information. Format each move exactly as: 'agent_3: move disk X from PEG1 to PEG2'. Do not output PDDL. Ensure the move sequence is self-consistent with the initial and goal configurations as far as your disk set is concerned.
generate_moves.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Output a single ordered list of primitive moves in the required format. If you need to reference other agents' actions, note dependencies but do not assume their moves; produce only moves you are authorized to perform.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the move lists provided by the three agents and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownwards solver. The PDDL must model three pegs, the 20 disks A..T, agent ownership of disk moves, and actions that preserve the Tower of Hanoi constraints. Keep agent move capabilities distinct in the PDDL (for example, separate action schemas or action names per agent). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Target FastDownwards semantics and requirements.
pddl.prompt: You will receive three ordered lists of primitive moves from the agents: {moves_agent_1}, {moves_agent_2}, {moves_agent_3}. Integrate these into a coherent PDDL domain and problem that represents the full multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and achieves the environment.init.goal_configuration from the environment.init.initial_configuration. Ensure action names remain distinct per agent and annotate or encode agent permissions. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. Produce only the PDDL output and no additional commentary.
